title: UK ‘working with US’ to analyse impact of supreme court’s ruling against tariffs
description: pGovernment ‘expects privileged trading position’ to go on as EU ‘seeks clarity’ over Trump administration’s next steps/ppBritain and the EU said they were assessing the implications of the a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/trump-supreme-court-tariffs-ruling"US supreme court ruling against Donald Trump’s global tariffs/a, while business groups reacted to the court’s announcement with caution./ppA spokesperson for Downing Street said: “The UK government is working with the US to understand how the overturning of Donald Trump’s tariffs by the supreme court will affect the UK but expects our privileged trading position with the US to continue.”/p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2026/feb/20/uk-eu-reaction-us-supreme-court-ruling-trump-tariffs"Continue reading.../a

title: Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian American, officials and witnesses say
description: pNasrallah Abu Siyam shot dead in occupied West Bank as UN human rights office accuses Israel of war crimes/ppIsraeli settlers in the occupied West Bank shot and killed a Palestinian American man during an attack on a village, the Palestinian health ministry and a witness have said./ppRaed Abu Ali, a resident of Mukhmas, said a group of settlers came to the village on Wednesday afternoon where they attacked a farmer, prompting clashes after residents intervened./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/israeli-settlers-west-bank-kill-palestinian-american-man"Continue reading.../a

title: Trump to impose 10% global tariff and attacks ‘certain’ supreme court justices after levies ruled illegal – live
description: pUS president declares a global tariff after saying ‘other alternatives will now be used to replace the ones that the court incorrectly rejected’/pullipa href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/trump-supreme-court-tariffs-ruling"Trump’s tariffs are illegal, supreme court rules/a/p/lilipa href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/trump-tariff-scotus-response"Trump threatens 10% global tariffs and rails against supreme court/a/p/lilipa href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/what-will-happen-to-trump-tariffs-after-supreme-court-verdict"What will happen to Trump’s tariffs after supreme court verdict?/a/p/li/ulpAccording to reporters at the supreme court, one box of opinions has been brought out./ppTypically, this means we can expect two decisions from the court./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2026/feb/20/us-iran-nuclear-deal-trump-agreement-strikes-latest-news-live-updates"Continue reading.../a

title: A fragile freedom for Venezuela’s released political prisoners
Residents in northern Lebanon terrified their buildings will collapse
Hamas reportedly holds leadership vote at critical moment for militant group
description: pNew head will face decisions crucial to movement’s future, such as how far to cooperate with Trump’s Gaza plan/ppHamas has reportedly begun holding leadership elections among its members at a time when the militant Palestinian movement faces imminent decisions which will be critical to its own continued existence and the potential for peace in Gaza./ppAccording to the BBC and press reports in the Gulf, Hamas members in Gaza have already voted. Those in the West Bank, in Israeli prisons and the diaspora are also expected to cast ballots for delegates to the movement’s 50-member general Shura council, which ultimately chooses its politburo and a new interim leader. The process could last weeks./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/hamas-reportedly-holds-leadership-vote-at-critical-moment-for-militant-group"Continue reading.../a

title: UN emergency food aid in Somalia may halt by April amid severe hunger
RSF siege of El Fasher in Sudan has ‘hallmarks of genocide’, UN mission finds
description: pReport details harrowing 18-month occupation of North Darfur capital, showing destruction aimed at ethnic communities/ppThe a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/oct/27/fears-civilians-sudan-paramilitary-rsf-capture-el-fasher"siege and capture/a of the Sudanese city of El Fasher by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces group last October bore “the hallmarks of genocide”, a UN-mandated fact-finding mission has said./ppIn a report detailing the harrowing 18-month occupation of the capital of North Darfur, investigators concluded that the RSF and allied militias deliberately inflicted conditions calculated to bring about the physical destruction of the Zaghawa and Fur ethnic communities./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/19/rsf-siege-el-fasher-sudan-hallmarks-of-genocide-un-mission-north-darfur"Continue reading.../a

title: Osaka stunned by anonymous gift of gold bars to fix ageing water pipes
description: pMayor says Japanese city will respect donor’s specification that £2.7m gift must be used to repair dilapidated system/ppOsaka has received a hefty gift of gold bars worth 560m yen (£2.7m) from an anonymous donor and a request for its specific use: to fix the Japanese city’s dilapidated water pipes./ppThe gold bars, weighing a total of 21kg (46lb), were given to the Osaka City Waterworks Bureau in November by the donor who wants to help improve ageing water pipes, the mayor, Hideyuki Yokoyama, told reporters on Thursday./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/osaka-stunned-by-anonymous-gift-of-36m-in-gold-to-fix-ageing-water-pipes"Continue reading.../a

title: Bodyguards for Azerbaijani president, in town for Trump’s Board of Peace, attack protesters in DC
description: pDemonstrators were outside hotel in Washington demanding the release of political prisoners in Azerbaijan/ppBodyguards traveling with the Azerbaijani president, who was visiting Washington for the inaugural meeting of a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump"Donald Trump/a’s Board of Peace, punched, kicked and chased protesters outside a Washington hotel on Thursday, a href="https://x.com/NoSezgin/status/2024560377921425507"video footage shows/a./ppDemonstrators calling for the release of political prisoners were driven from the street near the motorcade of Ilham Aliyev, the Azerbaijani leader./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/azerbaijan-trump-board-peace-protestors"Continue reading.../a
